Chinese banks approve $17 bln of loans under 'whitelist' project - housing authorityChina's housing authority said 123.6 billion yuan ($17.20 billion) of development loans have been approved and 29.4 billion yuan have been issued under a special mechanism aimed at injecting liquidity into the crisis-hit property sector. Wed, 21 Feb 2024 05:05:29 GMT DQ4QWBDIRJL53ICMKO3ZGK7II4 https://www.reuters.com/world/china/chinese-banks-approve-17-bln-loans-under-whitelist-project-housing-authority-2024-02-21/Reuters世界中国
Beijing shuts highways after heavy snowfallBeijing shut some highways on Wednesday after heavier-than-expected snowfall hit the Chinese capital overnight. Wed, 21 Feb 2024 04:38:35 GMT OMCIYA7H4JID5JMXTBKHF74PIA https://www.reuters.com/world/china/beijing-shuts-highways-after-heavy-snowfall-2024-02-21/Reuters商业环境
HSBC posts record high profit, misses estimate as China write-off bitesHSBC Holdings reported a record annual profit, that nonetheless came in below analysts' forecasts as the income boost from higher interests rates was offset by a hefty $3 billion charge from its stake in a Chinese bank. Wed, 21 Feb 2024 04:19:32 GMT 65HY677SVVJPLE7FHNCHHMTURY https://www.reuters.com/business/finance/hsbc-full-year-profit-jumps-78-trailing-estimate-2024-02-21/Selena Li, Lawrence White商业金融
Taiwan says it has not stepped up military deployments on frontline islandsTaiwan has not increased military deployments on frontline islands facing China and there is nothing unusual in the military situation around Taiwan, the defence ministry said on Wednesday amid a rise in tensions with Beijing. Wed, 21 Feb 2024 03:27:26 GMT LAKA5FSSAFLOXASGVWXDZXDEHI https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/taiwan-says-it-has-not-stepped-up-military-deployments-frontline-islands-2024-02-21/Yimou Lee, Ann Wang世界亚太地区
Hong Kong's population edges up to 7.5 mln, second year of post-COVID growthHong Kong's population rose 0.4% to 7.50 million in 2023, boosted by a net inflow of returning residents and people on residential schemes, the government said, as the financial hub marked its second year of population growth since the pandemic. Wed, 21 Feb 2024 03:15:58 GMT PKXCD25QJFKINEGH2KXU2FDASE https://www.reuters.com/world/china/hong-kongs-population-edges-up-75-mln-second-year-post-covid-growth-2024-02-21/Reuters世界中国
Asian shares ease as early rate cut bets fizzle, focus on Fed minutesAsian stocks eased on Wednesday as diminishing expectations of early interest rate cuts from the Federal Reserve sapped risk appetite, with investors looking to the minutes of the U.S. central bank's last meeting for clues on the policy outlook. Wed, 21 Feb 2024 02:28:43 GMT CPJH2ICVFBLT5BW6QBROH2VBRY https://www.reuters.com/markets/global-markets-wrapup-1-2024-02-21/Ankur Banerjee市场
Alibaba is the ultimate contrarian China bet“If you invest with us,” Jack Ma wrote in his inaugural letter to shareholders in 2014, “you will be embarking on a journey with Alibaba.” A decade on, the invitation from the Chinese e-commerce group’s co-founder and former chairman reads more like a warning. Following its New York stock market debut later that year, Alibaba’s , market capitalisation soared to reach $858 billion in 2020 only to t Wed, 21 Feb 2024 01:58:36 GMT QB4YHKV4C5O3XJDFMVUMFRD5LA https://www.reuters.com/breakingviews/alibaba-is-ultimate-contrarian-china-bet-2024-02-21/Robyn Mak突破性观点
Chinese man arrested in Australia faces extradition to US in North Korea smuggling caseA Chinese man arrested in Australia is awaiting extradition to the United States for alleged involvement in a North Korean scheme to generate revenue by selling counterfeit cigarettes, Australian authorities said on Wednesday. China disappointed over US veto on Israel-Hamas ceasefire vote - state mediaChina expressed "strong disappointment" over the United States blocking a draft United Nations Security Council resolution on the Israel-Hamas war calling for an immediate humanitarian ceasefire, Xinhua said on Wednesday, citing its U.N. representative Zhang Jun. Turkey detains six suspected of spying on Uyghurs for ChinaTurkish authorities have detained six people suspected of spying on Uyghurs in Turkey for China's intelligence service, and another suspect was being sought by police, state-run Anadolu news agency reported on Tuesday.
